§ 8572. Permit relief for picnic areas(a) In generalIf the Secretary concerned does not require the public to obtain a permit or reservation to access a picnic area on Federal recreational lands and waters administered by the Forest Service or the Bureau of Land Management, the Secretary concerned shall not require a covered person to obtain a permit solely to access the picnic area.
(b) Covered person definedIn this section, the term “covered person” means a person (including an educational group) that provides outfitting and guiding services to fewer than 40 customers per year at a picnic area described in subsection (a).
(Pub. L. 118–234, title III, § 352, Jan. 4, 2025, 138 Stat. 2916.)
